text: Signs and symptoms suggestive of sleep-disordered breathing in children Night-time symptoms Day-time symptoms Signs Snoring Day-time sleepiness Obesity (rare in children with OSA) Apnoea Hyperactivity Tonsillar hypertrophy Arousals or wakening Poor concentration Mouth-breathing Restless sleep Lethargy Failure to thrive Night sweats Social withdrawal Difficult to rouse in Poor school the morning performance
